text: Selective participation (4-5 agents per round) produces better debate quality than having all agents speak every round, while reducing cost by 90%.
Structured JSON claims with explicit confidence levels and evidence citations produce more rigorous analysis than free-form text responses.
A dedicated skeptic/red-team agent should participate in at least one round to challenge groupthink. Without adversarial pressure, expert panels converge too quickly.
The synthesizer should use a more capable model than the regular agents. The quality gap between Sonnet and Opus matters most during synthesis.
Showing agents the 6 most recent prior moves (not all moves) balances context awareness with token efficiency. Synthesizer should see all moves.
